Package com.ibm.streams.management.job

Interface JobMXBean

All Superinterfaces:
TransientMXBean
public interface JobMXBean extends TransientMXBean
JobMXBean provides attributes, operations, and notifications for managing a Streams job.

Note: The job must be registered before accessing any of these attributes or operations. See InstanceMXBean.registerJob(BigInteger) for more information.

ObjectNameBuilder.job(String, String, BigInteger) can be used to build the ObjectName for a JobMXBean.

Notifications:
A JobMXBean supports sending the following notifications:

javax.management.AttributeChangeNotification.ATTRIBUTE_CHANGE
Only a subset of the attributes support attribute change notification. A note is included in the attribute description for each attribute that supports attribute change notification

Notifications.JOB_CHANGED
Notifications.JOB_PERMISSIONS_CHANGED
Notifications.JOB_REMOVED
Notifications.OPERATOR_ADDED
Notifications.OPERATOR_REMOVED
Notifications.PE_ADDED
Notifications.PE_REMOVED
Notifications.RESOURCE_ADDED
Notifications.RESOURCE_REMOVED

Notification categories:
Use these with filters to enable or disable all notifications for a category.
Notifications.JOB_NOTIFICATION

    Stops the specified set of processing elements (PEs).
    String
    updateOperators(String configurationId, boolean preview, String listenerId)
    Makes changes to the job such as: update the configuration for a sub-graph of the job adjust the number of resources allocated to a sub-graph of the job change the size of a parallel region For more information about the types of changes supported, see the input configuration format description in the product documentation.

    • getAdlFile

      String getAdlFile()
      Returns the path, relative to where the application was installed on the resource, to the Application Description Language (ADL) file for the job.

      Note: This attribute is not included in the snapshot on a snapshot call if includeStaticAttributes is false.

      Returns:
      the relative ADL file path.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • getGenerationId

      BigInteger getGenerationId()
      Returns the generation identifier associated with the current job topology. The job topology can change (PEs added and removed) for operations such as updateOperators(String, boolean, String) and adjusting the size of a parallel region. The generation identifier is updated when the topology update is complete. Each job operation returns information from a single generation; however, multiple calls can return results from different generations. The generation identifier can be retrieved before and after a sequence of calls to determine whether the results are associated with the same job topology.

      Note: Attribute change notification is supported for this attribute.

      Returns:
      the job topology generation identifier for the job.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

      String getProductVersion()
      Returns the version of Streams being used to run the job.

      Note: This attribute is not included in the snapshot on a snapshot call if includeStaticAttributes is false.

      Returns:
      the product version. The format of the version is v.r.m.f<.h> where v, r, m, f, and h are all numeric values identifying the version, release, modification, fix, and optional hot fix levels.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

      the job topology updating indicator

    • assignPeTracingLevel

      void assignPeTracingLevel(DomainTracingPropertiesMXBean.Level level)
      Assigns the granularity of trace information stored for all PEs in the job.
      Parameters:
      level - identifies the new PE trace granularity.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if level is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • cancel

      void cancel()
      Cancels the running job.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.

    • cancel

      void cancel(boolean force)
      Cancels the running job. It optionally continues even if the processing elements cannot be stopped.
      Parameters:
      force - if true, continues with the cancel operation even if all PEs cannot be successfully stopped within the timeout period which is based on the value of InstanceMXBean.PropertyId HC_PEC_STOP_TIMEOUT.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • createOperationListener

      ObjectName createOperationListener()
      Creates an OperationListenerMXBean for tracking status messages associated with operations invoked on this bean. Once the operation listener is created, the listener Id can be passed as a parameter on operations which support it. An operation listener can be reused for multiple operation invocations; however, the behavior is undefined if it is used for concurrent operations. All existing messages are cleared at the start of each operation for which the listener is used. The unregister operation should be called on the operation listener after the listener is no longer needed to free the associated memory. All operation listeners are automatically unregistered when the monitored bean is unregistered. An operation listener is also automatically unregistered if it has had no activity for a certain amount of time. The inactivity time is controlled by the JMX_INACTIVITY_TIMEOUT property and is set to 30 minutes by default. If an operation listener bean is needed again, a new one can be created.
      Returns:
      the object name of the created listener bean.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.

    • deployOperatorConfiguration

      ContentTransfer deployOperatorConfiguration()
      Initiates the deployment of job configuration information to be used on an updateOperators call. The format of this configuration information can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Job configuration overlays reference.
      Returns:
      a ContentTransfer object containing a list of HTTPS URIs and a configuration identifier. To complete the deploy operation, perform an HTTP PUT to each URI returned as described below. The retuned URIs, by list index, are as follows:
      • 0 - the URI to use to perform an HTTP PUT of the configuration information. The content type on the PUT must be set to application/json.
      After completing the deploy operation, the changes identified by the configuration can be applied or a preview of the resulting job configuration can be generated by passing the returned configuration identifier on an {@code updateOperators) call. <p>Note: The job configuration is deployed temporarily. If it is not used to perform the changes within two minutes after the HTTP PUT completes, it is discarded. @throws IllegalStateException if the operation is unable to complete successfully.

    • retrieveApplicationLogAndTraceFiles

      String retrieveApplicationLogAndTraceFiles(String listenerId)
      Returns an HTTPS URI to retrieve all application trace and PE console log files for the job in tar archive format.
      Parameters:
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Returns:
      an HTTPS URI to access the compressed log and trace files in application/x-compressed format. This URI is valid for a single access for up to two minutes.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • OperationListenerMXBean

    • retrievePeRestartPriorities

      Map<BigInteger,PeMXBean.RestartPriority> retrievePeRestartPriorities(int resourceLoadThreshold)
      Retrieves the recommended processing element (PE) restart priorities for PEs in this job.
      Parameters:
      resourceLoadThreshold - specifies the resource threshold value to use when determining the priorities. The value is interpreted as follows:
      • greater than 0 - use the value exactly
      • 0, -1 or less than -3 - use the value specified in the instance configuration
      • -2 - use the average for all resources in the instance
      • -3 - use the middle resource average as the threshold
      Returns:
      the restart priorities for the PEs in the instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • retrieveProductLog

      String retrieveProductLog(String listenerId)
      Returns an HTTPS URI which can be used to access the Streams product log messages for the job. The product log contains service and application messages for use by administrators, instance owners, and application developers.
      Parameters:
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Returns:
      an HTTPS URI to access the product log messages in text/plain format. This URI is valid for a single access for up to two minutes.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • OperationListenerMXBean

    • retrieveProductLogMessages

      String retrieveProductLogMessages(String filters, String listenerId)
      Returns an HTTPS URI to retrieve a filtered set of messages for the job from the Streams product log. If there are multiple rolling product logs, the contents of all are filtered from oldest to newest. The product log contains service and application messages for use by administrators, instance owners, and application developers.
      Parameters:
      filters - identifies the set of filters to apply to the product log messages. Only messages matching all filters are returned. The format of the filters value is a serialized string of a JSON object. Possible properties included in the object are:
      • LoggingPropertiesMXBean.FILTER_CONTENT A regular expression string or an array of regular expression strings. Only messages containing content matching the specified regular expressions are returned.
      • LoggingPropertiesMXBean.FILTER_LEVEL A string or an array of strings. Each value specifies a message log level. The value must be the value returned by LoggingPropertiesMXBean.Level.toString(). Only messages with the specified logging levels are returned.
      • LoggingPropertiesMXBean.FILTER_COUNT An integer specifying the maximum number of messages to return.
      • LoggingPropertiesMXBean.FILTER_START_TIME A long specifying a start time as the number of milliseconds since the epoch. Only messages with a timestamp after this time are returned.
      • LoggingPropertiesMXBean.FILTER_END_TIME A long specifying an end time as the number of milliseconds since the epoch. Only messages with a timestamp before or equal to this time are returned.
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Returns:
      an HTTPS URI to access the filtered product log messages in text/plain format. This URI is valid for a single access for up to two minutes.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if filters is not in the correct format or an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • retrieveZooKeeperStorageNode

      String retrieveZooKeeperStorageNode()
      Retrieves a ZooKeeper storage node path that can be used by the job operators to store information. If the node does not exist, it is created.
      Returns:
      the ZooKeeper storage node for the job.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • DomainMXBean.getZooKeeperConnectionString()

    • startPes

      void startPes(Set<BigInteger> pes, String resourceId, String listenerId)
      Starts the specified set of processing elements (PEs).
      Parameters:
      pes - specifies the identifiers of the PEs to start.
      resourceId - specifies the Streams unique identifier for the resource on which to start the PEs. If the value is null, resource selection will be done from the instance resource list. Null is the recommended value for most users.
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if pes is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • OperationListenerMXBean

    • startPes

      Parameters:

Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.

    • snapshot

      String snapshot(int maximumDepth, boolean includeStaticAttributes)
      Takes a current snapshot of the job attributes and returns an HTTPS URI to retrieve the results. Attributes of descendant objects and static attributes can optionally be included.
      Parameters:
      maximumDepth - specifies which descendant object attributes should be included in the snapshot. Values are handled as follows:
      • less than zero - all descendant attributes are included.
      • zero - no descendant attributes are included.
      • one - only attributes for immediate child objects are included. Immediate children include: PEs. Note: the related domain, instance, and job attributes are not repeated for each PE.
      • greater than one - attributes for descendants are included up to the level specified.
      includeStaticAttributes - indicates whether static attributes should be included in the snapshot. A static attribute is a attribute that does not change and that is not an identifier attribute. A note is included in the attribute description for each attribute that is not included in the snapshot if includeStaticAttributes is false.
      Returns:
      an HTTPS URI to access the attribute values in application/json format. This URI is valid for a single access for up to two minutes.

      The attribute values are provided in JSON format. This format is described in the product documentation. See topic: REST management API reference > Download job snapshot. The following differences exist for the JMX output:

      • The REST specific properties: resourceType, restid, and self are not included.
      • The views, hosts, operators, peConnections, and operatorConnections properties are not included.
      • The values of the domain and instance properties are the unique identifiers for each.
      • An object array resources property is included. There is an array element for each resource on which a PE in the job is running. Each object element contains an id property with the value being the unique resource identifier.
      • The pes property is only included if maximumDepth is non-zero. The value for this property is an embedded array containing snapshot objects for each PE. For the format of this object, see: PeMXBean.snapshot(int, boolean)
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • snapshotMetrics

      String snapshotMetrics()
      Takes a current snapshot of the metrics for all PEs in the job and returns an HTTPS URI to retrieve the results.
      Returns:
      an HTTPS URI to access the metric values in application/json format. This URI is valid for a single access for up to two minutes.

      The metric information is provided in JSON format. The top-level object contains two properties: an id property containing the job identifier and a pes array. Each element in the array contains the following properties:

      • id - the PE identifier.
      • indexWithinJob - the index of the PE within the job.
      • lastTimeRetrieved - the time when the metric information was retrieved as milliseconds since the epoch or zero if metrics have never been retrieved from the PE.
      • metrics - an array with each element containing information a single metric. The format of the metric elements is described in the product documentation. See topic: REST management API reference > Download job metrics snapshot. The following differences exist for the JMX output:

        • The REST specific properties: next, previous , total, resourceType, and owner are not included.
        • The lastTimeRetrieved property is not duplicated for each metric.
      • The metrics for the descendant objects are included as embedded array properties with the following property names: inputPorts, outputPorts, operators. The outputPorts array contains connections descendants and the operators array contains inputPorts and outputPorts descendants. The elements of each of these arrays contain a metrics property with the same format as described in metrics. The following additional properties are included for the different descendant types:
        • inputPorts, outputPorts - indexWithinPe for PE ports and indexWithinOperator for operator ports.
        • connections - id
        • operators - indexWithinJob
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • stopPes

Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.

      NullPointerException - if pes is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:

      • OperationListenerMXBean

    • updateOperators

      String updateOperators(String configurationId, boolean preview, String listenerId)
      Makes changes to the job such as:
      • update the configuration for a sub-graph of the job
      • adjust the number of resources allocated to a sub-graph of the job
      • change the size of a parallel region
      For more information about the types of changes supported, see the input configuration format description in the product documentation. See topic: Job configuration overlays reference.

      The target sub-graph of the job can be specified by a set of operators, a set of PEs, or both. If neither operators or PEs are specified, the currently stopped PEs are used.

      The PEs that are hosting the operators of the sub-graph must be stopped before invoking this operation. Alternatively, the forcePeStopped option can to be specified in the input configuration. The PEs hosting operators of the sub-graph, after the changes are complete, are started as part of this operation.

      The operation fails if any of the following are true.

      • The effects of the new configuration extend beyond the target set of operators.
      • The target PEs identified by the new configuration cannot be placed due to unsolvable placement constraints.
      • The target PEs identified by the new configuration cannot be placed due to a resource removal.
      • Any of the target operators identified by the new configuration are not restartable or not relocatable.
      Parameters:
      configurationId - Identifies the deployed input configuration that specifies the changes to make. See deployOperatorConfiguration for information on deploying the configuration information.
      preview - specifies whether the configuration that would result from running the operation should be returned without making any changes.
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Returns:
      an HTTPS URI to access the updated job configuration information. The content type of the configuration information is application/json. The format of this configuration information can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Job configuration overlays reference. This URI is valid for a single access for up to two minutes.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • OperationListenerMXBean
